personalInfo.splInterest: Music, movies, reading and working out

tourBios.carHigh:
2015: Enjoyed his best of four full seasons on PGA TOUR Latinoamérica to finish 12th on the Order of Merit… Made the cut in 15 of 17 starts, collecting four top-10s and eight top-15s… His best finish was T2 at the Dominican Republic Open in June. Shot under par the last three days to finish three strokes behind tournament champion Rodolfo Cazaubón… Had 36 rounds in red numbers to rank fifth in sub-par rounds on PGA TOUR Latinoamérica... Earned Web.com Tour conditional status with a T93 finish at the Q-School final in December.

2014: Collected six top-25s to finish the PGA TOUR Latinoamérica season ranked No. 40 on the Order of Merit. Made the cut in 10 of his 16 starts… Had T12 finishes at the Colombia Open in February and at the Ecuador Open in September… Missed the cut by one at the Colombian Championship on his second career start on the Web.com Tour… Won the 56th Abierto Ciudad de Bucaramanga in July to collect his first career win as a professional. On that event, which counted for the Developmental Series and the Colombian Tour, he won by three shots by carding a 65 (-7) on the final round.

2013: Finished the PGA TOUR Latinoamérica season ranked No. 34 in the Order of Merit. Had one top-5 finish, four top-25 finishes and 5 cuts made in 11 starts. His best finish was T3 at the Dominican Republic Open in June.

2012: Made six cuts in nine starts, with one top-10 and two top-25 finishes on the inaugural season of PGA TOUR Latinoamérica. Finished No. 39 in the Order of Merit to keep his card for 2013. His best finish was solo seventh at the season opening Mundo Maya Open in September. His lowest round was a 5-under par 66 at the Arturo Calle Colombian Coffee Classic, an event he finished T15.

2011: Reached the Tour de las Americas' season-ending 52nd Abierto del Club de Golf Sport Francés Copa NISSAN in Chile ranked No. 46 in the Order of Merit and needing a strong finish in order to crack the top-40 that would earn the 2012 PGA TOUR Latinoamérica card. Accomplished that goal with a T3 finish to close the year ranked No. 29 in the Order of Merit. Also finished 11th at the III Copa Antioquia in Rionegro, Colombia and T12 at the Torneo de Maestros Copa Personal in Buenos Aires, Argentina to make it one top-5 and three top-15 finishes in six TLA starts… Missed the cut at the Preferred Wichita Open on his first career start on the Web.com Tour. 

2010: Finished first at the NGA Hooters Tour Ranking School… Finished T7 at the 63rd Colombian Open and T18 at the Televisa Players Championship in his only two starts on the Tour de las Americas.

2009: Turned professional in July… Alternates playing in Latin America with minitours in the United States.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Played college golf at Texas Tech… Had one college win at the Ron Smith USF Invitational and was named 2008 and 2009 PING Division I All-Region Team… South American champion in three different age divisions… Finished T8 among Boys 15-17 at the Callaway World Junior Golf… Named Colombian Amateur of the Year in 2003… A Colombian National Champion in two different age divisions (Junior and Men).
tourBios.personal: Has a brother, Daniel, and a sister, Cristina… Studied economy at Texas Tech… Affiliated to the Club Campestre de Cali in Colombia… Lives a portion of the year in Windemere, Florida… Hobbies include working out, going to the movies and reading… Says music is a passion for him… Twitter: @rivasgolf… Instagram: @santiago_rivas

tourBios.exmtStatus: Conditional - Finished T93 at 2015 Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR Latinoameri was T2nd in 2015 at the Dominican Republic Open.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks T64th in Total Eagles on the Latinoamérica.
